snippet.title: CVS Health's journey from legacy tools to seamless developer experience | GitHub
snippet.description:
What happens when you migrate 150,000 repositories from a tangled web of legacy CI/CD tools to GitHub? CVS Health found out — and lived to tell the tale. They reshaped their entire developer experience by consolidating disparate tools into GitHub and GitHub Actions, freeing their platform teams to build instead of maintaining outdated systems. The result? Thousands of developers now share a modern workflow that makes collaboration faster, easier, and more consistent across one of healthcare's largest tech organizations. You'll walk away with real lessons from their journey, including what worked, what didn't, and practical strategies you can apply to your own large-scale migrations.

Speakers:
Irene Modeste, Sr Product Manager - Developer Experience, CVS Health (Speaker)
Jim Beyers, VP, Developer Experience, CVS Health (Speaker)
Mitch Enderle, Executive Director, Platform Engineering, CVS Health (Speaker)

#GitHubActions #GitHubUniverse #GitHub

— CHAPTERS — 

00:00 Introduction and CVS Health's mission 
03:42 The vibrancy technology strategy 
05:50 Improving developer experience and tool standardization 
10:58 Moving to a unified platform with GitHub EMU 
14:19 Planning the repository migration at scale 
16:24 Solutions for migration challenges 
18:47 Migration roadmap and results 
20:10 Future steps: CI/CD pipeline migration

Watch more videos from GitHub Universe 2025: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nSwj2Ma0pnk&list=PL0lo9MOBetEFKNlPHNouEmVeYeyoyGTXC

About GitHub:
It’s where over 100 million developers create, share, and ship the best code possible. It’s a place for anyone, from anywhere, to build anything—it’s where the world builds software. https://github.com
